title: Karnataka Woman, Lover Check Into Lodge. She Was Found Dead With Her Mouth Blown Up
content: A village in the Mysuru district of Karnataka woke up to a grisly crime this morning. A 20-year-old married woman was brutally killed by her lover, who set off explosives in her mouth.

title: "Parties That Have Lost Ground Are...": New Mumbai BJP Chief Targets Thackerays
content: Newly-appointed Mumbai BJP president Ameet Satam hit the ground running, striking an aggressive tone as he took charge of the city unit.

title: Dharmasthala Row Explained: Inside Facts, Claims, And A Masked Man
content: The temple town of Dharmasthala in Karnataka - one of the major pilgrim centres of the southern state -- has been caught in a raging controversy after a man claimed he was forced to bury and cremate around a hundred women.

title: Jurassic Park In Jaisalmer? Fossil Found In Rajasthan Is That Of Phytosaur
content: Fossil remains discovered last week in a village near Rajasthan's Jaisalmer have now been identified as belonging to a phytosaur, making it the first well-preserved specimen of the prehistoric era reptile found in India.

title: Trump, Family Launch New Crypto Venture, Experts Raise Red Flags
content: The Trump family's latest venture involves World Liberty Financial, a cryptocurrency initiative co-founded by the US President and his sons.

title: Watch: Man Brings Gun To Cricket Tournament In Indore, Fires Multiple Shots
content: A cricket tournament match in Indore turned dangerous when a young man pulled out what appeared to be a rifle and fired several rounds into the air.

title: Opinion: Opinion | India To Kabul To Pak: The Plot Behind Chinese Foreign Minister's Many Tours
content: This is China stepping into the breach created by Trump's shenanigans. It seems to be viewing the problem through the lens of South Asia as a whole, rather than letting Washington use its divide-and-rule strategy.

title: Harvard Is Aligning With Trump Demands, Even As Negotiations Continue
content: Harvard University is overhauling its campus structure, offices, and leadership in response to demands from the Trump administration.

title: 20 Killed In Israeli Strikes On Gaza Hospital, 5 Journalists Among Them
content: Gaza's civil defence agency said five journalists were among at least 20 people killed Monday when Israeli strikes hit a hospital in the south, with Reuters, the Associated Press and Al Jazeera mourning their slain contributors.

title: Fresh Power Tussle In Karnataka? Event To Honour State Minister G Parameshwara Sparks Buzz
content: The auditorium is heavily lit. Big cutouts of Karnataka Home Minister G Parameshawara cover the stage. Scores of people are gathered around a framed painting of the Congress leader. They are celebrating "Paramotsava", an event to celebrate the leader

title: Delhi High Court Sets Aside Panel's Order To Disclose PM Modi's Degree
content: The Delhi High Court on Monday set aside an order of the Central Information Commission (CIC) directing disclosure of information on the bachelor's degree of Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: Jodhpur Lecturer Sets Herself, Daughter On Fire, Note Points To Dowry Harassment
content: A school lecturer set herself on fire along with her three-year-old daughter in Rajasthan's Jodhpur district on Friday.

title: Telangana Chief Minister Makes Landmark Visit To Hyderabad's Osmania University
content: Telangana chief minister Revanth Reddy made a landmark visit to Osmania University today, becoming the first sitting Chief Minister to officially visit the campus for a major event in over two decades.

title: Arvind Kejriwal's Questions To Amit Shah On 'Sack Jailed Ministers' Law
content: Hours after Union Home Minister Amit Shah defended the proposed law to remove ministers accused of serious offences if they are jailed for more than a month, Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader Arvind Kejriwal hit back

title: MK Stalin Invited To Ayyappa Summit In Kerala. BJP Resists
content: BJP's Rajeev Chandrasekhar said that the party will "resist" the participation of Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan and his Tamil Nadu counterpart M K Stalin in the Global Ayyappa Sangamam at Sabarimala if they do not apologise to Hindus.

title: "Wise To Refrain From Name-Calling": Ex-Judges On Amit Shah's Remarks On Opposition's Veep Pick
content: A group of retired judges has termed Home Minister Amit Shah's attack on opposition vice-presidential candidate B Sudershan Reddy over the Salwa Judum judgement "unfortunate", and said it would be wise to refrain from "name-calling".

title: India Entering Golden Period Of Space Exploration: Shubhanshu Shukla
content: India is entering the "golden period" of space exploration, with both vision and technical capability aligning to turn ambitious dreams into reality, said the country's 21st-century space hero and astronaut Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla.

title: Bengali Actor, BJP Leader Joy Banerjee Dies At 62 After Prolonged Illness
content: Bengali actor and Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leader Joy Banerjee passed away on Monday after a prolonged illness.

title: Toddler Raped By Neighbour In Delhi; Found Naked, Covered In Blood By Mother
content: A one-year-old girl was raped by a 32-year-old man in Delhi today, officials said. The incident took place in the Bijwasan area of Delhi around 9;00 AM.

title: Use Of Pen Drives, WhatsApp Banned In J&K Government Departments
content: The Jammu and Kashmir government has banned the use of pen drives in all departments and also barred WhatsApp messaging service for official communications.

title: 'Work from jail?' BJP mocks oppn attack on 'criminal bill'; Kejriwal's 'personal' reply
content: Arvind Kejriwal has launched a sharp retort to Amit Shah's defense of the 130th constitutional amendment bill, which proposes disqualifying lawmakers jailed for over 30 days in serious cases. Kejriwal questioned the ethics of inducting criminals into parties and rewarding them with high office. Shah expressed confidence that the bill, aimed at upholding constitutional morality, would pass despite opposition.

title: Dowry death: Nikki's father says 'affair' led to murder; probe reveals pattern of violence
content: Nikki Bhati died after allegedly being set on fire by her husband and in-laws over dowry demands, prompting her father's desperate plea for justice. Following this, Nikki's husband, Vipin, was shot in the leg during an attempted escape while in police custody.

title: 'Never in India's history': Amit Shah reveals what led to his 2-year Gujarat exile
content: Amit Shah clarified his departure from Gujarat during the Sohrabuddin Sheikh case. He stated he offered to leave after a court expressed concerns about evidence tampering. Shah also defended the government's bill regarding the removal of lawmakers facing serious charges. He highlighted his own resignation upon receiving a CBI summons. The bill is currently under review by a parliamentary committee.

title: What's behind India's China shift? Goyal explains; hints at 'tons' of reforms
content: Amidst potential US tariffs, India asserts its improved relations with China are separate from US trade talks. Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal expresses confidence in India's economic resilience and ongoing efforts to deepen the India-US relationship.

title: 'Flop scene': BJP mocks TMC MLA's 'clownish' escape bid; targets CM Mamata
content: BJP IT chief Amit Malviya criticized TMC MLA Jiban Krishna Saha's attempt to evade the ED as a staged act orchestrated by Mamata Banerjee, following Saha's arrest in connection with the teachers' recruitment scam. Malviya alleged that such stunts are a TMC strategy to avoid accountability for looting Bengal, further claiming the party fears exposure as the 2026 elections approach.

title: AI and jobs: Microsoft AI CEO to workers; My central worry is many will be left behind
content: Microsoft AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman cautions that AI's rapid advancement may outpace people's ability to adapt, leading to a significant skill gap rather than widespread job losses. He urges governments, companies, and educators to prioritize reskilling programs and digital literacy.

title: PM Modi degree row: Delhi HC says DU not bound to share BA records
content: The Delhi High Court overturned a Central Information Commission (CIC) order on Monday, which had instructed the disclosure of information pertaining to Prime Minister Narendra Modi's bachelor's degree. Justice Sachin Datta delivered the verdict following a petition from Delhi University challenging the CIC's directive.

title: 'Aadhar bhi bheju kya?': Sachin Tendulkar silences fan with hilarious comment
content: Sachin Tendulkar's recent Reddit AMA session became a hit, filled with humor and insights. When a fan questioned his identity, Tendulkar playfully responded, “Should I also send my Aadhaar card?” He discussed his favorite innings, the 2008 knock against England, and revealed advising MS Dhoni's promotion in the 2011 World Cup final.

title: Infiltration bid foiled: Soldiers spot suspicious movement, open fire; search ops on
content: In Jammu and Kashmir's Uri sector, Indian troops initiated search operations after spotting suspicious movement and opening fire along the Line of Control. Earlier, multiple drones from Pakistan were observed hovering over forward areas in the Poonch district, prompting security forces to launch a search operation.

title: Red states vs blue states: LinkedIn founder warns Democrats; says tech feels alienated
content: Reid Hoffman believes the Democratic Party has alienated a segment of Silicon Valley by targeting crypto and Big Tech. He regrets this division, noting that California's regulations push companies to innovate elsewhere. Hoffman points out that red states are fostering innovation in areas like autonomous vehicles, suggesting Democrats should learn from their policies.

title: 'Two reasons': Sachin Tendulkar breaks silence on promoting MS Dhoni over Yuvraj Singh
content: Sachin Tendulkar engaged with fans in a Reddit AMA, confirming his suggestion to promote MS Dhoni in the 2011 World Cup final, citing the left-right combination and Dhoni's familiarity with Muralitharan. He also highlighted his unbeaten 103 against England in Chennai in 2008 as his most meaningful innings, recalling India's successful chase of 387 and subsequent series victory.

title: 'Hallmark of cowardly govt': Rahul after protesters lathicharged; 'time to fight back'
content: Congress leaders, including Rahul Gandhi, have strongly criticized the central government over the alleged lathi-charge on SSC aspirants protesting in Delhi, accusing the Modi government of ignoring the youth's concerns and manipulating elections. The leaders condemned the police action, while Delhi Police denied the lathi-charge, stating that some protestors were detained for refusing to leave after the permitted time.

title: Ilona Maher hints at WWE future after World Cup; says she’s single, staying focused
content: Rugby star Ilona Maher is garnering attention both on and off the field. WWE has expressed interest in her, but Maher emphasizes that no decisions will be made until after the Women’s Rugby World Cup 2025.

title: Google abandons virtual hiring model: CEO says AI cheating unstoppable;
content: Google is reintroducing in-person job interviews as CEO Sundar Pichai addresses concerns about AI-driven cheating during virtual hiring. This decision marks a shift from the remote practices adopted during the pandemic. Employees raised the issue, prompting Google to balance efficiency with the need to ensure the authenticity of the hiring process, acknowledging that competitors face similar challenges.

title: Z+ security for Delhi CM: 40 personnel to protect ; how two-layer protection will work
content: Following a recent attack, Delhi Police has significantly enhanced security for Chief Minister Rekha Gupta, upgrading her protection to Z+ cover. Over forty personnel will be permanently deployed, and stringent checks will be implemented at all her events, including 'Jan Sunwai' programs. The enhanced measures include a two-circle security system and thorough frisking of all visitors, ensuring the chief minister's safety.

title: Trump spotted with hand makeup, swollen ankles; concerns over venous condition rise
content: US President Donald Trump's recent public appearances have sparked health concerns due to visible makeup on his hands and previously reported swollen ankles. The White House confirmed Trump has chronic venous insufficiency (CVI), though officials claim he experiences no discomfort. Despite assertions of health transparency, public speculation persists, fueled by images and a recent poll indicating doubts about full disclosure.

title: 'They wanted Mercedes or Rs 60L': Kin of Noida dowry victim recall torture
content: Nikki, a 26-year-old woman, was allegedly murdered by her in-laws in Greater Noida for dowry, sparking outrage and demands for strict action. Her family recounts years of harassment, including physical assault and escalating demands for money and luxury items.

title: Rohit Sharma meets fan girl, signs her painting, gesture goes viral - See pics
content: Rohit Sharma, adored by fans, recently charmed a young admirer with a signed portrait. He transitioned from Test and T20I cricket, potentially returning for an ODI series against Australia.

title: OPT in crisis: Why Indian students in US could be hardest hit by F-1 visa shake-up
content: The OPT program, a crucial pathway for international students seeking U.S. work experience, faces potential elimination and new taxes, creating uncertainty. Indian students, the largest group of STEM graduates, could be significantly impacted, potentially leading to decreased enrollment and a shift of talent to countries with more stable post-study work options. Universities and employers also risk losing talent and revenue.

title: ITR filing: How to download Form 16? Step-by-step guide for taxpayers
content: ITR filing FY 2024-25: Salaried taxpayers preparing to file their Income Tax Return (ITR) for AY 2025-26, with a deadline of September 15, 2025, should have their Form 16 ready. This form, downloadable from the TRACES portal, details taxable salary income and taxes deducted.

title: UP: Shubhanshu Shukla meets CM Yogi Adityanath; CM announces scholarship in his name
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, India's first astronaut on Nasa's Axiom-4 mission to the ISS, met Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath in Lucknow after returning from the US. He previously presented PM Modi with the Axiom-4 mission patch and shared photos of Earth from space. Shukla completed an 18-day mission, conducting over 60 experiments, marking a milestone for India's Gaganyaan programme.

title: No Sunil Chhetri! Khalid Jamil confirms 23-man squad for CAFA Nations Cup
content: Khalid Jamil has announced India's 23-member squad for the CAFA Nations Cup in Tajikistan, notably excluding veteran striker Sunil Chhetri. Mohun Bagan's players are unavailable, impacting selection. Anwar Ali, Naorem Mahesh Singh, and Jeakson Singh Thounaojam are included. India faces Tajikistan, Iran, and Afghanistan in Group B, with Jamil aiming to improve India's AFC Asian Cup qualifying performance.

title: Bengali actor and BJP leader Joy Banerjee passes away after prolonged illness
content: Bengali actor Joy Banerjee, a prominent figure in Tollywood during the 1980s and 90s, passed away at 63 in Kolkata on Monday. He was admitted to a private hospital on August 15, battling Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease. Known for hits like 'Hirak Jayanti' and 'Milan Tithi,' Banerjee also contested elections on a BJP ticket before resigning from politics.

title: Israel hits Gaza hospital again, 15 dead including 4 journalists
content: An Israeli airstrike on Nasser Hospital in Khan Yunis, southern Gaza, resulted in at least 15 fatalities, including four journalists and a civil defense member. Reports indicate a "double-tap" strike, with initial and follow-up missiles targeting the area as rescue crews arrived. Several news agencies confirmed the deaths of their journalists and contractors in the attack.

title: Delhi Metro fare hike: DMRC raises prices starting today; check new rates
content: Delhi Metro fares have increased for the first time in years, impacting daily commuters. Effective Monday, fares are up by Rs 1 to Rs 4, with the minimum fare now Rs 11 and the highest Rs 64. Airport Express Line fares also see a rise. The DMRC calls the revision minimal but necessary to balance operational costs.

title: India vs Pakistan at Asia Cup: 'Cross-border tensions still persist'
content: Amidst heightened tensions following the Pahalgam attack, Congress leader Gaurav Gogoi has appealed to the BCCI to reconsider India's Asia Cup match against Pakistan scheduled for September 14 in Dubai. Gogoi argues that playing cricket at this time would compromise national interest and undermine diplomatic efforts to hold Pakistan accountable.

title: Conor McGregor and Beckham share unforgettable yacht meeting during Italy holiday
content: UFC star Conor McGregor and football legend David Beckham had a chance encounter on the Amalfi Coast in Italy. McGregor, vacationing on his yacht, met Beckham, who was with his family on his own yacht. McGregor shared photos on Instagram, expressing his admiration for Beckham as a long-time inspiration and acknowledging the Beckham family's influence.

title: 'Jinnah's dream': Himanta slams Sayeda Hameed for 'legitimising infiltration'
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma criticised activist Sayeeda Hameed for supporting illegal infiltration. Sarma accused Hameed of trying to make Assam part of Pakistan. He stated that Assam's identity is at risk because of such support. Union Minister Kiren Rijiju also attacked Hameed's statement. Prime Minister Narendra Modi has expressed concerns about the rising population of illegal immigrants.

title: Jumped wall, threw phone in drain: How TMC MLA tried to evade ED
content: Trinamool Congress MLA Jiban Krishna Saha was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in connection with the teachers' recruitment scam. Saha allegedly attempted to escape during the raid, throwing his mobile phones into a drain. The arrest follows previous action by the CBI in April 2023 and is based on an FIR related to irregularities in hiring schoolteachers.

title: Raja Jackson attack video shows Syko Stu left unconscious at KnokX Pro Los Angeles event
content: At a KnokX Pro Wrestling event in Los Angeles, Raja Jackson, son of Quinton “Rampage” Jackson, violently attacked Syko Stu, leaving him unconscious and convulsing. Despite Stu's critical condition, the match continued, sparking outrage online. The incident has prompted investigations, calls for accountability, and discussions about safety protocols in professional wrestling, with KnokX Pro and Quinton Jackson issuing statements.

title: YouTuber Sagar Kundu swept away while making video in Odisha
content: A 22-year-old YouTuber from Berhampur, Sagar Kundu, was swept away by strong currents at Duduma waterfall in Koraput district while filming a live video. Despite warnings from friends about the rising water level, he ventured into the stream.

title: Indonesia Boat Race: 11-year-old aura farmer makes festival a global phenomenon
content: An 11-year-old boy's viral dance moves have revitalized Indonesia's Pacu Jalur boat race, drawing record crowds and international attention. Rayyan Arkan Dikha's energetic performance at the bow of a boat has attracted millions of views, inspiring even international sports stars to join the craze.

title: Online Gaming Bill 2025: How many crores will BCCI lose after Dream11 exit? - Details inside
content: Dream11 is ending its title sponsorship of the Indian cricket team following the passage of the 'Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming Bill 2025,' which led to the shutdown of their real money games operations.

title: Tripura woman tied, hair chopped off over affair charge
content: In Tripura's Udaipur, a woman named Purnima Das was publicly tortured, accused of an extramarital affair. A mob, allegedly instigated by BJP leaders, tied her up, forcibly cut her hair, and mocked her. The incident, filmed by onlookers, sparked outrage, but police have reportedly targeted the victim's relatives instead of the instigators.

title: ICSI CS Executive Toppers 2025: Tithi Bohra obtains AIR 1 for June session
content: The Institute of Company Secretaries of India (ICSI) has declared the CS Executive Programme June 2025 results, with Tithi Bohra securing the top rank. Surender Pal and Mogulapally Jyothi followed, achieving AIR 2 and AIR 3 respectively. Successful candidates can now advance to the CS Professional Programme after completing registration and practical training.

title: ‘It’s not freedom of speech’: SC pulls up Samay Raina for mocking disabled
content: The Supreme Court has instructed five social media influencers, including Samay Raina, to publicly apologize for mocking individuals with disabilities. This directive follows allegations of ridiculing people with Spinal Muscular Atrophy and blindness. The court emphasized that freedom of speech cannot infringe upon the right to dignity, and further decisions on penalties will be determined later.

title: First major contact since Op Sindoor: India alerts Pak on possible flooding
content: Despite the suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty after the Pahalgam attack, India has alerted Pakistan about a potential flood in the Tawi River. The information was reportedly conveyed through diplomatic channels, marking a significant communication between the two nations amidst strained relations. Pakistani authorities have issued warnings for vulnerable areas following the alert.

title: 'Time for both to move forward': Netanyahu says Israel could withdraw from Lebanon
content: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu lauded Lebanon's commitment to disarming Hezbollah by 2025, envisioning a potential reduction in Israel's military presence in southern Lebanon. However, Hezbollah has rejected the disarmament plan, demanding Israeli withdrawal from contested areas and a halt to airstrikes. The group accuses Beirut of succumbing to US pressure, asserting the ceasefire only requires scaling back south of the Litani River.

title: Ottawa Pride parade: Event scrapped after pro-Palestinian protesters block route
content: Ottawa's Pride parade was abruptly cancelled after pro-Palestinian activists blocked the route, demanding Capital Pride support boycotts against Israel and apologize for officials boycotting the 2024 event. The group, Queers for Palestine, halted the march near Parliament Hill, leading to disappointment among participants. Despite the cancellation, the Pride street festival continued as planned.

title: 'Currently stable': Syko’s brother breaks silence after Raja Jackson attack
content: Independent wrestler Syko Stu was brutally attacked by Raja Jackson at a KnokX Pro Wrestling Academy event, resulting in severe injuries and an LAPD investigation. Stu's brother, Andrew, has released a statement confirming Stu is in critical care and warning fans about fraudulent GoFundMe campaigns.

title: Highway to hell? 68 dead in 113 crashes on Delhi–Gurgaon Expressway in 2025
content: In Gurgaon, a concerning number of accidents on NH8 prompted the traffic police to establish a special monitoring cell. Using advanced software, the cell detects stationary vehicles on the expressway within five seconds, enabling swift removal to prevent congestion and accidents.

title: Hyderabad man kills 5-month pregnant wife; dumps body parts in Musi river
content: In a shocking incident in Hyderabad, a man allegedly murdered his pregnant wife following marital discord. He dismembered her body and disposed of some parts in the Musi River. The accused, S Mahender Reddy, confessed to the crime after police found the victim's torso at their residence and grew suspicious during a missing person's report.

title: Fitch affirms India’s credit rating at 'BBB-': Trump’s tariffs seen as ‘moderate’ risk
content: Fitch affirms India's credit rating at 'BBB-' with a stable outlook, buoyed by strong growth and robust external finances, despite potential US tariffs. While these tariffs pose a moderate downside risk, their direct GDP impact is expected to be modest.

title: Not Gukesh, Anand! Meet only Indian to beat No. 1 Carlsen in classical with black
content: Karthikeyan Murali, the 26-year-old Grandmaster from Thanjavur, holds a unique place in Indian chess history. In 2023, at the Qatar Masters, he became the only Indian to beat Magnus Carlsen with the black pieces during the Norwegian’s 14-year reign as World No. 1. A two-time national champion, Murali’s accidental chess journey now carries one unforgettable milestone.

title: Rajasthan rain fury: Udaipur mine turns death trap; Amer fort's wall collapses
content: Heavy rains in Rajasthan have led to widespread flooding and tragic incidents, resulting in six deaths, including four minors. Dausa recorded the highest rainfall, causing severe disruptions and prompting rescue operations in several districts. Schools have been closed, and authorities are on high alert as the weather department forecasts continued heavy rainfall for the next few days.

title: Cheteshwar Pujara retires: Wife pens heartfelt note - 'You have been living by Bhagavad Gita'
content: Cheteshwar Pujara has retired from all forms of Indian cricket. His wife paid tribute to his career and calm demeanor. She reflected on his dedication to the sport. Pujara represented India in 103 Tests. He scored 7,195 runs. He is remembered for his resilience, especially in the 2018-19 Test series win in Australia. He expressed gratitude for representing India.

title: Siddalinga Swami seeks action against Priyank Kharge, Naribol for provocative speech
content: He also criticises the district authorities for issuing a notice asking him to refrain from delivering provocative speeches

title: Three arrested for ₹2.5 crore loan fraud in Eluru
content: Accused submitted false Aadhaar, PAN, and fake property documents at AU Small Finance Bank Limited to obtain the loan, says Eluru SP

title: Destination Committee reviews progress of ‘Alappuzha–Global Water Wonderland’ project
content: Centre gave approval for project under Swadesh Darshan 2.0 scheme in April this year. The ₹93.17-crore project is expected to give a major boost to tourism in district

title: State-level job fair in Mysuru on Sept. 6; 120 companies to take part
content: The job fair is not limited to graduates alone, as candidates with SSLC and PUC qualifications are also eligible to participate

title: Dagadarthi, Kuppam airports in Andhra Pradesh set for take-off under PPP model
content: Government approves draft RFP and clears way for land acquisition, utilities shift, and infrastructure development at two of the State’s planned greenfield airports

title: PM Modi holds roadshow in Ahmedabad ahead of rally
content: PM reached the Naroda area and held a 2-km-long roadshow from Haridarshan crossroads till Khodaldham ground in the Nikol area of the city

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Minister inaugurates Vijnana Alappuzha Skilling Initiative 2025
content: Group discussions and thematic presentations were held with the participation of representatives from various colleges

title: Govt. urged to resolve academic confusion faced by degree students
content: ‘Although degree classes began a month ago across the State, guest lecturers are yet to be appointed in many colleges’

title: DMK government cancelled a plan designed during AIADMK rule to build check-dams across Cauvery: Palaniswami
content: During AIADMK rule, we identified lakes for desilting, desilted 6,000 tanks, and drew up plans for check-dams from Mettur up to where the Cauvery joins the sea. An order was issued to build check-dams at four locations, but the DMK cancelled it after coming to power, says the AIADMK general secretary

title: Maharashtra government to offer all citizen services on WhatsApp soon
content: As many as 1,001 services are to be delivered through the Aaple Sarkar portal, of which 997 have already been made available

title: Finalise NRC in Assam before SIR of voters’ list: CPI(M)
content: A hurried revision on the Bihar model will not yield an accurate electoral roll, the party’s State secretary said

title: NTK’s leadership confident Vijay would not be able to eat into its ‘politically conscious’ support base
content: Sources in the NTK admit that Mr. Vijay may not pose an electoral threat but could be a disruptor to the firebrand Tamil nationalism that the NTK has championed over the past 15 years

title: Kalikanathur-Puthenkulangara road in Mannar panchayat inaugurated
content: The ₹3-crore project was completed with 60% funding from the Union government and 40% from the State government

title: BJP MP Narayan Rane pleads not guilty before court in defamation case filed by Sanjay Raut; to face trial
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) leader had filed a complaint against Narayan Rane for allegedly making “defamatory, malicious and false” remarks about him at the Konkan Festival organised in suburban Bhandup in January 2023

title: Boney Kapoor moves Madras High Court over Sridevi’s Chennai property dispute
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh directs Tambaram Tahsildar to take a decision within four weeks on the producer’s plea to cancel a “fraudulent” legal heirship certificate

title: Supreme Court collegium recommends Justices Alok Aradhe, Vipul Pancholi for top court
content: If the names are cleared by the Centre, Justice Pancholi would be in line to become the CJI in October 2031 after retirement of Justice Joymalya Bagchi

title: Prominent builder and philanthropist Ghiasuddin Babukhan passes away
content: He founded Hyderabad Zakat and Charitable Trust (HZCT) in 1992-93, marking the beginning of a focused effort to establish structured systems of charitable giving

title: Govt. will ensure speculative media reports are not made in ‘sensitive’ Nimisha Priya case, Attorney General tells SC
content: The top law officer said the government was working to save the woman’s life; he advised quiet, and to not ‘muddy the water’

title: Outrage in Assam after Syeda Hameed bats for Bangladeshis’ stay
content: Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma slammed the former Planning Commission member for trying to legitimise illegal infiltrators

title: Jammu and Kashmir bans pen drives in government offices to strengthen cybersecurity
content: The order also said that all sensitive technical information, including ICT architecture diagrams, system configurations, vulnerability assessments, IP addressing schemes and strategic technology plans, must be classified as confidential and handled exclusively through approved secure channels

title: Jubilee Hills Bypoll: A prestige battle for Congress, BRS and BJP
content: High-stakes triangular contest in Jubilee Hills bypoll among Congress, BRS, and BJP is likely to shape Telangana politics.

title: CBFC explains to Madras High Court why Rajinikanth-starrer Coolie was given ‘A’ certificate
content: Appearing before Justice T.V. Thamilselvi, Additional Solicitor General explains the procedure followed while certifying movies

title: Our soldiers did not kill terrorists based on their religion, but because of their deeds: Rajnath Singh
content: Rajnath Singh also lauded the people of border areas for supporting the administration and the armed forces during the military operation to avenge the Pahalgam terror attack

title: Give Marathas reservation within legal framework by August 26 or face agitation: Jarange
content: Jarange has called for a protest at the Azad Maidan in Mumbai from August 29, demanding reservation for the Maratha community in education and government jobs under the OBC category

title: CM tells officials to file chargesheet within stipulated time in Atrocities Act cases in Karnataka
content: The Chief Minister said that conviction has taken place only in 36 cases while 679 cases are in investigation stage

title: P.C. George, Swapna Suresh chargesheeted for alleged conspiracy against Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan
content: Case was registered in 2022 following complaint by Thavanur MLA K.T. Jaleel after Swapna Suresh made allegations about CM’s involvement in 2020 gold smuggling incident. Jaleel alleged that P.C. George was part of the conspiracy behind Swapna Suresh’s allegations

title: Mehbooba holds protest in Srinagar, seeks return of Kashmiri prisoners from outside jails
content: The party leaders alleged the police heckled Ms. Mufti when she was on the way to join her supporters

title: How many years should a person be imprisoned for including ‘criminals’ in parties: Arvind Kejriwal asks Amit Shah
content: “Under a political conspiracy, when the Central Government framed me in a false case and sent me to jail, I ran the government for 160 days from jail,” Arvind Kejriwal said

title: PM Modi’s degree row: Delhi HC quashes CIC order on disclosure of Delhi University’s records from 1978
content: On the RTI plea of Neeraj, an activist, the CIC had ordered DU to allow inspection of its register containing details of all students who passed the BA examination in 1978 — including their roll numbers, names, fathers’ names and marks — and to provide certified extracts of the relevant pages

title: From Maoist hotbed to progress: Bastar witnessing new dawn of development, says CM Vishnu Deo Sai
content: “In Bastar, the sound of school bells, roads and progress is replacing the sound of bullets,” Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai said, adding the region is now witnessing a new dawn of hope and development

title: The best 100 players in the NFL this season: Our experts' ranking, starting with four QBs in the top five
content: We predicted the top players in 2025. How many Eagles are ranked? Is Patrick Mahomes still No. 1? Where does Myles Garrett land?

title: Who were NFL Rank's 10 worst snubs? Scouts and execs ID the misses
content: Only 100 players can make the player rankings. Here are 10 more that league insiders felt should have been there.

title: Bonzi survives Medvedev's meltdown, late surge
content: Daniil Medvedev and Benjamin Bonzi's match was delayed more than six minutes between points Sunday night after a photographer entered the court on match point.

title: Fleetwood wins Tour Championship, FedEx Cup
content: After many near misses, Tommy Fleetwood finally notched his first PGA Tour victory Sunday after posting a 2-under 68 to finish 18 under in the Tour Championship, three strokes ahead of Russell Henley and Patrick Cantlay at East Lake Golf Club in Atlanta.

title: Had it with heckler, Ohtani hits 45th HR in win
content: A heckler next to the Los Angeles dugout spent his entire Sunday giving an earful to the visitors, including a nonstop barrage of digs and chirps at Shohei Ohtani, before the Dodgers star crushed his 45th homer in an 8-2 victory over the San Diego Padres.

title: Source: U-M to name Underwood starting QB
content: True freshman Bryce Underwood is expected to be named Michigan's starting quarterback, a source confirmed to ESPN's Pete Thamel.

title: USMNT's McKennie target of racist abuse
content: USMNT's Weston McKennie was subjected to racist abuse after Juventus completed a 2-0 win over Parma in the Serie A, the Italian club said Sunday.

title: Grieving Chisholm's HR helps Yankees stop skid
content: Jazz Chisholm Jr.'s two-run home run in the second inning Sunday night at Yankee Stadium gave New York its first lead against the Boston Red Sox since Thursday night's series opener, and ignited a 7-2 victory for the Yankees, who improved to 70-60.

title: Chinese Taipei wins 18th LLWS title; 1st since '96
content: Chinese Taipei won its first LLWS since 1996, although its 18 titles are the most of any country besides the United States.

title: Raleigh hits 48th, 49th HRs to set catcher record
content: Mariners slugger Cal Raleigh hit his major-league-leading 48th and 49th home runs on Sunday against the Athletics, breaking the single-season record for catchers.

title: 🏈 Adam Schefter's fantasy football cheat sheet
content: No one is more plugged in to the latest buzz around the NFL than Adam Schefter. We asked him to share his favorite values in fantasy drafts with you.

title: 10 pre-cut-down-day trade proposals that benefit both teams: Why these deals make sense
content: We proposed trades involving  Richardson, Trey Hendrickson and Adam Thielen ahead of the season. What could teams get in return?

title: Pay or trade Trey Hendrickson? The answer is very simple. Here's how things got complicated
content: There's no end in sight for the contract dispute between the Bengals and Hendrickson. What could be next?

title: Live tracking NFL cuts, trades and final roster moves around the league
content: We're following releases, trades, signings and other intriguing moves for all 32 NFL teams before the 4 p.m. ET roster cut-down deadline on Tuesday.

title: Final 53-man roster projections for every NFL team: What we learned in preseason Week 3
content: The NFL preseason slate is over, and teams have started making moves ahead of final roster cuts on Tuesday.

title: Over/under predictions for MLB stars: What will Judge's WAR be? 61 homers for Raleigh? How many K's for Skubal?
content: Some players are on pace for incredible final numbers. We asked our MLB experts to decide who will keep it up -- and who will lose steam down the stretch run.

title: Where Raleigh's catcher HR record ranks among all-time surprising power seasons
content: The Mariners slugger made long ball history. Here's how his year stacks up with other shocking breakouts.

title: NBA predictions 2025-26: Biggest turnarounds, turbulence and questions this season
content: Which NBA teams will reach new heights and which will take a tumble? Which superstar will request a trade next? ESPN's Summer Forecast answers some of the biggest questions going into the 2025-26 season.

title: NHL draft prospect watch list: Who joins Gavin McKenna?
content: With the Hlinka-Gretzky Cup complete, draft season is here. Here are the top skaters to watch for next June.

title: Book excerpt: Does the future of college football need a commissioner?
content: On Sept. 2, "Forward Progress: The Definitive Guide to the Future of College Football" will be released.

title: Putting a fair price on every position in college football
content: Max Olson talked to general managers and agents from around the country to put a price tag on each position.

title: Experts' picks: Who will win the US Open?
content: The US Open begins Sunday, with superstars Alcaraz, Sinner and Gauff in the draw. Our experts make predictions.

title: Man City's No. 1 headache, Mbappé saves Real Madrid, Arsenal's depth on display, more
content: Tottenham's win at Man City exposed Pep Guardiola's goalkeeper headache, while Kylian Mbappe rescued Real Madrid as Xabi Alonso continues to tweak his team, as Marcotti recaps the weekend.

title: The VAR Review: Why Man United's goal wasn't ruled out; Trafford's red-card escape
content: Looking at why Manchester United were awarded a penalty at Fulham, but their goal was allowed to stand.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool to return for Newcastle's Isak
content: Newcastle United are preparing themselves for Liverpool to make another bid to sign striker Alexander Isak. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Key issues to watch with one week to go in the transfer window
content: The transfer window closes on Sept. 1. Liverpool, Man United, Tottenham and Man City are all going to be busy.

title: 2025 boxing contenders: Who can win fighter of the year?
content: A look at the boxers who have the biggest chance to get the honors and how they can secure the award.

title: Canadian star Brooke Henderson victorious in Ontario
content: Brooke Henderson won her second CPKC Women's Open title Sunday, beating Minjee Lee by a stroke for her first victory in more than 2 1/2 years.

title: Jon Rahm's team outlasts Bryson DeChambeau's in LIV final
content: Jon Rahm and Legion XIII outlasted Bryson DeChambeau and the Crushers in a playoff Sunday in the LIV Golf League team final.

title: NFL betting guide: Four keys to help you navigate the 2025 season, plus early picks
content: Ben Solak looks at bets to take advantage of -- and ones to avoid -- and offers his strategy and early plays for the 2025 season.

title: Madras High Court sentences police officer to three-month imprisonment for forging Inspector’s signature in charge-sheet
content: Justice P. Velmurugan finds the Special Sub-Inspector of Police guilty of contempt of court for having forged the signature in the charge-sheet filed despite a stay order

title: Osmania University should build necessary intelligentsia required to uphold Telangana: CM Revanth
content: CM says Osmania University owns up people’s problems anywhere in the State, assures to approve plans for its development.

title: Supreme Court refuses to advance date of hearing on pleas on J&K statehood
content: On August 14, a bench headed by Chief Justice B.R. Gavai had sought within eight weeks the Centre's response on a separate plea seeking restoration of statehood to the Union Territory

title: Firing at Elvish Yadav’s house: Two suspects arrested in Delhi
content: The two men were allegedly acting under orders of jailed gangster Neeraj Faridpuria and his associate Himanshu Bhau, who had arranged weapons, funds, and logistics for the attack on Yadav’s house on August 17

title: Supreme Court decides to appoint amicus over ‘ecological imbalance’ in Himachal Pradesh
content: A Bench of Justices Vikram Nath and Sandeep Mehta was hearing a suo motu case over the ecological and environmental conditions in Himachal Pradesh

title: Panic as smoke rises from Alappuzha-Dhanbad Express coach
content: Train was halted for inspection and railway officials later said the smoke was caused by brake binding

title: Sivankutty advises Rahul Mamkootathil to keep away from school science fest in Palakkad, but denies dropping Congress MLA from organising panel
content: Kerala General Education Minister says complaints against Rahul Mamkootathil about alleged inappropriate and misogynistic behaviour ‘has sparked concern among parents and teachers’

title: India, Fiji decide to boost defence ties
content: Prime Minister Modi also said that India and Fiji support a free, inclusive, open, secure and prosperous India-Pacific

title: Kerala High Court dismisses PIL against Thomas Isaac’s appointment as Vijnana Keralam advisor
content: Stating that it was ‘unfortunate’ that Thomas Isaac was subject to such a petition, Division Bench observes that the writ petition was unsupported by proper research

title: V.D. Satheesan dares Kerala CM to act against ‘sex offenders’ in government, CPI(M)
content: Satheesan says Congress has set a ‘shining example’ in Kerala’s political history by suspending Rahul Mamkootathil, MLA, despite the lack of a complaint to the party or the police

title: Nine students injured as private school van overturns on railway track in Cuddalore
content: When the van reached the level crossing at Poovanur, the driver reportedly lost control of the vehicle, and dashed it against a pole near the level crossing. In the impact, the vehicle overturned on the railway track

title: Ruckus in Jharkhand Assembly over Surya Hansda's death in 'encounter'
content: As soon as the House assembled for the day, MLAs of both sides trooped into the Well and started raising slogans

title: DSEL develops mobile app for live tracking of government schools in Karnataka
content: The testing of this app has been conducted successfully and officers have already been trained to use the same

title: Kerala Pradesh Congress Committee non-committal on Rahul Mamkootathil’s resignation as MLA
content: KPCC president Sunny Joseph says neither CPI(M) nor BJP has the moral authority to demand Rahul Mamkootathil’s resignation

title: Victims of crime, their heirs can file appeal against acquittal of accused: Supreme Court
content: A Bench of Justices B V Nagarathna and K V Viswanathan said the right of a victim of a crime must be placed on a par with the right of an accused who has suffered a conviction

title: Death sentence can be challenged under Article 32 on ground of breach of procedural safeguards, says Supreme Court
content: The top court also said the exceptional scope of Article 32 cannot be permitted to become a routine pathway for reopening concluded matters

title: Social media influencers monetise free speech, Supreme Court observes
content: Supreme Court asks Union government to consider guidelines to regulate conduct on social media with ‘effective consequences’

title: CESC issues safety guidelines for public celebration of Ganesha festival in Mysuru region
content: Cautioning the organisers against drawing unauthorised power connections by hooking onto electricity lines, he said permission for a proper connection should be obtained from the respective office of the CESC sub-division or branch

title: T.N. illegal kidney sale racket: Madras High Court seeks order cancelling private hospital’s licence
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh passes the order after Dhanalakshmi Srinivasan Medical College and Hospital in Perambalur challenges a press release issued on August 10, 2025

title: Opposition parties slam Delhi police for using force against SSC aspirants; police deny charge
content: SSC students and trainers staged a protest at Ramlila Maidan on Sunday (August 24, 2025), demanding better conduct of the examination

title: ETM upgrade key to rollout of Shakti Scheme smart cards in Karnataka
content: Two years on, Shakti Scheme smart cards have been delayed by the upgrade of electronic ticketing machines across transport corporations

title: Heavy rains in Punjab's Pathankot; holiday declared in educational institutions
content: Several villages near the India-Pakistan border in Pathankot district of Punjab have been affected after the water level in Ujh, Ravi rivers and rivulets rose following heavy rains in Jammu and Kashmir and Himachal Pradesh

title: ‘He should have resigned when he was jailed’: Amit Shah on Arvind Kejriwal
content: Now, he will have to give his resignation lawfully, the Union Home Minister says, advocating for the proposed Bills that seek the removal of ministers jailed for serious criminal charges

title: Dream11 parts ways with BCCI as Indian cricket team’s title sponsor after real money gaming ban
content: Dream11 might not have to pay any hefty penalty as the contract with the Indian board has a specific clause about getting a waiver in case there is a government regulation in place

title: Stray dog attacks: BBMP considering whether to bring back CNVR in Bengaluru flouting AWBI guidelines
content: A major concern surrounding CNVR is post-surgery complications, such as stitches reopening and extreme fatigue

title: Dhankhar resigned for health reasons, shouldn’t make a fuss over this: Amit Shah
content: Home Minister Amit Shah, in an interview to ANI, dismissed Opposition’s claims that the former Vice-President has been placed under “house arrest”

title: Kerala to object to UGC’s draft curricula, alleges Hindutva bias
content: UGC’s proposals for nine undergraduate subjects have sparked widespread criticism from sections of academic community

title: IndiGo flight with Assam CM on board diverted to Agartala due to bad weather in Guwahati
content: The aircraft, later, flew to Guwahati after an improvement in the weather conditions in Guwahati, said K.C. Meena, the director of the Maharaja Bir Bikram (MBB) Airport at Agartala

title: Congress suspends Kerala MLA Rahul Mamkootathil from primary membership amid misconduct charges
content: Senior Congress leader and former KPCC president K. Muraleedharan says onus is now on Rahul Mamkootathil to decide whether the latter should continue as MLA from Palakkad

title: Farmers begin gathering at Jantar Mantar in Delhi for ‘Kisan Mahapanchayat’
content: The Samyukta Kisan Morcha said the gathering will remain peaceful and urged farmers and supporters to participate in large numbers

title: ED arrests Trinamool MLA Jiban Krishna Saha in West Bengal school recruitment scam
content: The MLA from Burwan Assembly constituency in Murshidabad district was in 2023 arrested by the CBI on similar charges and was out on bail

title: Drones sighted near LoC in J&K’s Poonch, search operation underway
content: The officials said the drones, believed to be launched for surveillance, were seen flying very high and returned to the Pakistani side within five minutes

title: Revanth Reddy’s visit Osmania University today, marks a new chapter
content: Revanth Reddy will be the first Chief Minister to address the students on the campus after Telangana was formed.

title: Noida dowry murder case: All four arrested after brother-in-law and father-in-law held today
content: The accused, identified as Satveer Bhati (55) and Rohit Bhati (28), were arrested by Kasna Police near Sirsa Toll Chauraha following a tip-off and manual intelligence inputs, the police said

title: Farmers being sold bags of soil in the name of fertiliser in Kalaburagi, allege KRRS leaders
content: To demonstrate their allegations, farmers’ leader Mahanthagouda Nandihalli and his associates opened two fertiliser bags during the press conference and showed that they contained large amounts of dry soil

title: Shubhanshu Shukla gets rousing welcome in Lucknow
content: Shubhanshu will participate in a car parade starting from the airport, which will proceed through the Gomti Nagar Vistar Campus to G-20 Chowk

title: Unfortunate, prejudicial misinterpretation: Retired judges slam Amit Shah’s remarks on Sudershan Reddy
content: The group of 18 retired judges said that “prejudicial misinterpretation” of the top court’s verdict by a high political functionary is likely to have a chilling effect on its judges

title: Learn to play around with AI tools and get fluent, Microsoft India President advises
content: Shrugging-off a recent MIT Media Lab study raising an alarm over AI and its potential cognitive consequences and neural costs, Chandok said he believes AI boosts rather than diminishes cognitive abilities

title: Maharashtra couple dies after liver transplant surgery; notice issued to Pune hospital
content: The Sahyadri Hospital has been directed to submit all details pertaining to the transplant procedure by Monday

title: Permit to Starlink bars copying, decryption of Indian data overseas: MoS Telecom
content: Minister of State for Communications Pemmasani Chandra Sekhar said the Department of Telecommunications (DoT) granted a Unified License (UL) to Starlink Satellite Communications Private Limited after the U.S. firm agreed to the terms and conditions

title: Heavy rains lash Himachal Pradesh, schools shut in five districts
content: The local meteorological office has issued a yellow warning for heavy rain in isolated areas of two to seven districts in the state till August 30

title: TikTok ban not lifted, clarifies government sources amid reports of website being accessible
content: "Government of India has not issued any unblocking order for TikTok. Any such statement/news is false and misleading," sources clarified

title: How have deception techniques evolved? | Explained
content: What are AI-enabled X-Guard Fibre-Optic Towed Decoy systems? What are some other systems comparable to the X-Guards? How has Ukraine deployed decoys in its war against Russia? Do navies also employ countermeasures to protect warships? How has India fared with deception decoys?

title: Nine dead, 43 injured as truck hits tractor-trolley carrying pilgrims in Uttar Pradesh's Bulandshahr
content: Two of the deceased were children while 12 of those injured and hospitalised are below the age of 18, police said

title: Odisha man arrested for conducting delivery without medical degree, causing two deaths
content: Police said the nursing home had misled the family, assuring them it had all necessary facilities for a safe delivery

title: India will buy oil where it gets 'best deal': Indian envoy to Russia
content: Mr. Kumar said that trade between India and Russia is based on mutual interests and market factors, and added that it is done with the "overall objective of ensuring the energy security of 1.4 billion people of India"

title: JSP will organise ‘Senatho Senani’ in Visakhapatnam from August 30, says Nadendla Manohar
content: Party president Pawan Kalyan will focus completely on JSP affairs during the three-day conclave, says the PAC chairman

content: the new big two of men's tennis is overwhelmingly favored to make it three straight Slam finals against each other . Aryna Sabalenka is a brilliant 67-13 on the season but has fallen short late in all three Slams and must fend off a torrid Iga Swiatek .

title: 'His kids were getting messed with at school': How Ryan Day handles the pressures at Ohio State
content: Ohio State coach Ryan Day leans back into the leather couch in his office days away from the showdown against top-ranked Texas . day took over for Urban Meyer in 2019 after just two seasons on his staff . only two other active college football head coaches have won national titles . "you'll never get the benefit of the doubt with elizabeth ii," says day .
